project.name: JSON Viewer Lite
project.description: A simplified JSON viewer built with React + MobX (frontend) and FastAPI (backend). Users can upload session JSON files and visualize basic behaviors like scatter plots, heatmaps, and timelines.
goals: Use only React + MobX for state management
Use FastAPI as the single backend
No Node.js API layer in the MVP
Avoid over-engineering or adding unnecessary services
rules: Always keep backend under /backend and frontend under /frontend
Do not generate advanced backend layers unless requested
Visualizations must use D3.js or heatmap.js
Avoid unnecessary abstractions, factories, or complex patterns
Follow REST best practices for FastAPI endpoints
guidelines: When generating frontend code, prefer functional components
Use MobX stores instead of Redux or Context API
Write FastAPI endpoints in a simple router-based structure
Keep code modular but not fragmented
